item.title: Thomas Pynchon Saw Where America Was Headed. What Does He See Now?
item.description: The novelist anticipated our bizarre present. How does his latest book hold up in an age of eroding reality?

item.title: If an Energy Drink Drank an Energy Drink, You’d Get a Celsius
item.description: How a turbocharged upstart brand came to threaten Red Bull and Monster’s dominance.

item.title: Do Spouses Have Mustache Veto Power?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over the limits of facial-hair autonomy.

item.title: The Suffix That Tells Us to Ruthlessly Optimize Everything
item.description: From game theory to incels, how everything got ‘-maxxed.'

item.title: My Liberal Friend Won’t Protest. Do I Drop Her?
item.description: I feel like apathy is how we got here in the first place.

item.title: The Rules of Investing Are Being Loosened. Could It Lead to the Next 1929?
item.description: A group of financiers is trying to convince the public to invest heavily in private equity and crypto — a risky gambit with some real 1920s vibes.

item.title: How Getting Stoned With My Dad Helped Us Heal
item.description: It was the therapy we needed, and the fun we deserved, after decades of estrangement.

item.title: Five Takeaways From the Magazine’s Profile of Zohran Mamdani
item.description: How the Democratic nominee for mayor who has stunned the New York establishment is working to shore up support and sustain his momentum.

item.title: The Culture Wars Came for Wikipedia. Jimmy Wales Is Staying the Course.
item.description: Attacks on the site are piling up. Its co-founder says trust the process.

item.title: Is It Bad to Buy Into a Gentrified Neighborhood?
item.description: I can finally afford to live in the area I once only dreamed of calling home. But I’m torn.

item.title: Can You Make Use of Your Neighbors’ Trash Cans?
What Trump’s War on Sanctuary Cities Is Really About
item.description: A movement born in churches to help vulnerable immigrants has become a constitutional battleground in Chicago and Portland, Ore.

item.title: Lady Gaga Was Always Gothic. Now the World Has Caught Up to Her.
item.description: At a moment when other pop stars are flirting with dark spectacle, Gaga’s “Mayhem” tour shows that she has perfected it.

item.title: The Battle Inside Israel Over Who Must Fight in Its Wars
item.description: The conflict over compulsory service for the nation’s ultra-Orthodox has become a stand-in for a larger struggle over the country’s right-wing, religious turn — and could determine its future.
